7.text: He wanted us all to travel out west to see a total solar eclipse.

8.text: So, we all agreed to fly out with him and hike up some mountain in Oregon to see it.

9.text: I still can't beleive that Logan forgot his glasses; thank goodness Nick happened to have an extra pair. (I sure wasn't sharing.)

10.text: Once we got to the top of the trail, we sat down in a small open field and waited.

11.text: As the sky darkened, we looked up and saw the moon beginning to shift over the sun.

12.text: I saw some birds returning to their nests and shadows growing longer like the sun was setting.

13.text: After a moment, I realized that the latter didn't make any sense.

0.text: The shadows kept growing, quickly reaching around us like they were trying to wrap themselves around our little clearing.

1.text: Besides the fact that they were moving quickly towards us and didn't really match up with the shapes of the trees surrounding us, I rememeber something else unnatural about them.

2.text: I remember that it... it almost looked like the edges of the shadows had little fingers that they were withering as they stretched out towards us.

3.text: I remember yelling out as the edges touched me since they were noticably colder than the ambient air we'd been sitting in.

4.text: I think I also heard Howie let out a huge gasp that cut off abruptly as we all started running away, panicking.

5.text: The next thing I remember is waking up down here in this cave.

0.text: I haven't seen Nick or any of our other friends.

1.text: This place is really weird; supernatural, even.

2.text: I keep wondering if any of this is real or if it's just playing out in my head.

3.text: Maybe I'm laying in a hospital bed somehere: who knows.

4.text: Thank goodness I packed a decent amount of food and water for the trip, although it's still not much.

5.text: I know I should set out further to look for everyone or even find an exit, but it's hard to when I don't even know how I got here.

6.text: I have no special skills to survive, especially on my own.

8.text: But, I've got to do this: what other choice do I have?

0.text: All I can say is... well, here I go.
